name: Wikimon
tagline: Create an artificial intelligent pet that learns to chat through mirroring
body: # **Overview** Wikimon is a Python script which creates an artificial intelligent digital pet that learns through mirroring. Users can chat with an fully-conversant artificial intelligent virtual friend that learns and imitates previous chats in context. Licensed under the MIT License - [https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT) ### Features - Remembers conversation history, then learns by mirroring it - Works with any Linux operating system - Starts-up with an input of user's phone number - 3-step configuration wizard that requires less than 1 minute to set-up ### System Requirements - Python 2.7 - These instructions have been tested on Ubuntu 14.04.3 and 15.10. ----------------------- # **Wikimon Diagram** ----------------------- # **Animated Tutorial**                               ----------------------- # **Getting started** First, install yowsup by following these steps: Clone jlguardiâ€™s yowsup fork and install it: ``` $ git clone https://github.com/jlguardi/yowsup.git && cd yowsup $ sudo apt-get install python-setuptools python-dev $ sudo python setup.py install $ cd .. ``` At the time of writing (31 March 2016), the official yowsup source code does not work. There is, however, a fork by jlguardi which does work. The following steps were successfully tested but please note that the jlguardi fork may not necessarily work in the future. Register your phone number: ``` `$ git checkout Android_2.12.440 $ sudo ./yowsup-cli registration --requestcode sms --phone --cc --mcc --mnc $ sudo ./yowsup-cli registration --register --phone --cc ``` For the and required by the two commands above, find them [here](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mobile_country_code). After registration, configure and run the server: ``` $ git clone https://github.com/facerecog/wikimon.git && cd wikimon $ sudo python setup.py install $ sudo python src/server.py ```
